I don't think the pop-metal genre is any different than others. There will always be some bands that have long careers with multiple hits, and other that just have that one hit in them. As for the examples you have here, they each have various reasons for their success (or limited success), but I can't think of any reasons that are specific to this type of music.

"Zoo Station" on Achtung, Baby by U2. Just a few years after The Joshua Tree and Rattle and Hum -- that song announces that they've taken their sound into a place that in no way rehashes what had made them the most popular rock band in the world in the late 80s. Pretty brave thing to do when it would have been easy to crank out The Joshua Tree II.

A Frankenstein glow-in-the-dark poster from a box of Honeycomb cereal that was taped to the wall next to my bed. Must have been four at the time, and when the lights went out for bedtime, that green face creeped me the hell out.
The Godfather III. The first two are my top favorites of all time. Part III made me feel like I'd watched a great writer and director sell-out.
